questions_and_notes: Temperature is not defined when there is no snow so "where snow" is needed.  According to description, only land areas should be considered (exclude sea ice), but comment says "all snow in the grid cell".  If the former, where directive should be  "where snow (on land, with samples weighted by snow mass)"; if the latter, simply "where snow (with samples weighted by snow mass)".   Note that  land includes areas of ice_sheet (excluding ice-shelves).
cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean (with samples weighted by snow mass)
comment: This temperature is averaged over all the snow in the grid cell that rests on land or land ice.  When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Reported as missing in regions free of snow on land.
